subject: Career
title: Negotiating in a Recession
description: A 60-second lesson on Negotiating in a Recession.

hook.text: Layoffs are in the news. Negotiating feels tone-deaf. But even in downturns, leverage exists.

buildup.text: Companies still hire critical roles in recessions. If they're offering, they need you.

discovery.text: In a soft market, negotiate non-salary items: job security clauses, severance, remote flexibility.

twist.text: Accepting a low offer 'because of the economy' sets a base that follows you for years.

climax.text: Be respectful but firm: 'I understand the market. Here's what I need to make this work.'

punchline.text: Recessions end. Your accepted salary doesn't reset.

quiz.question: What should you focus on negotiating during a recession?
